keyword: how many calories in a chicken quesadilla taco bell
title: How Many Calories in a Taco Bell Chicken Quesadilla?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a chicken quesadilla Taco Bell, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, and variations for your fast-food tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in a Taco Bell Chicken Quesadilla?
assumptions: Standard Taco Bell Chicken Quesadilla: grilled flour tortilla with chicken, three-cheese blend, creamy jalapeño sauce; no modifications.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, preparation, and customizations. Values based on Taco Bell's standard recipe; check app or menu for latest.

quick_answer.text: A Taco Bell chicken quesadilla contains about 510 calories and 28 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Fresco style (no cheese or sauce, add pico de gallo)

faqs.q: How many calories in a Taco Bell chicken quesadilla?
faqs.a: Approximately 510 calories for one standard quesadilla.

faqs.q: What are the macros in a chicken quesadilla Taco Bell?
faqs.a: About 44 g carbs, 28 g protein, 27 g fat, with 3 g fiber.

faqs.q: Is the Taco Bell chicken quesadilla high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 1240 mg sodium per quesadilla—watch if on a low-sodium diet.

faqs.q: How does the chicken quesadilla compare to beef at Taco Bell?
faqs.a: Chicken version has 510 kcal; beef is similar at ~470 kcal but higher fat.

faqs.q: Can I make a lower-calorie Taco Bell chicken quesadilla?
faqs.a: Opt for fresco style or skip sauce to reduce by 100-150 kcal.
